thread.title: Former DeMatha Stag, current Redskin Arie Kouandjio gives back to Beltsville

title: Former DeMatha Stag, current Redskin Arie Kouandjio gives back to Beltsville
text:
Former DeMatha Stag, current Redskin Arie Kouandjio gives back to Beltsville Current Washington Redskin Arie Kouandjio gives back to his former elementary school, Beltsville Academy. Post to Facebook Former DeMatha Stag, current Redskin Arie Kouandjio gives back to Beltsville Current Washington Redskin Arie Kouandjio gives back to his former elementary school, Beltsville Academy.  //on.wusa9.com/1FJi6yF   Join the Conversation To   Former DeMatha Stag, current Redskin Arie Kouandjio gives back to Beltsville Kristen Berset and WUSA 9 Staff, WUSA 5:30 p.m. EDT October 1, 2015 Aug 13, 2015; Cleveland, OH, USA; Washington Redskins offensive guard Arie Kouandjio (74) in a preseason NFL football game against the Cleveland Browns at FirstEnergy Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Andrew Weber-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Andrew Weber, Andrew Weber-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BELTSVILLE, Md. (WUSA9) -- Former DeMatha star and current Redskins offensive lineman Arie Kouandjio paid a special visit to his former elementary school in Beltsville, Md. to promote reading. 
As part of the Redskins Read Program, Kouandjio delivered Redskins Read Playbooks to fourth and fifth graders at Beltsville Academy. Arie Kouandjio visits Beltsville Academy, the elementary school he attended as a child, and delivers Redskins Read Playbooks to 4th and 5th graders. 
Kouandjio was a blue-chip offensive line recruit out of DeMatha Catholic in Hyattsville in 2010. He went on to attend the University of Alabama where he won two national championships alongside his brother, Cyrus. The Redskins selected Arie in the fourth round (112th overall) in 2015's NFL draft. 
You can find out more about Redskins Read by clicking here .
